    • Method Detail

      • generateCode

        public static void generateCode(Connection connection,
                                schemacrawler.schemacrawler.InclusionRule schemaRule,
                                schemacrawler.schemacrawler.InclusionRule tableRule,
                                String targetPackage,
                                String classPrefix,
                                Path targetDirectory,
                                DataTypeProvider dataTypeProvider,
                                NameProvider nameProvider,
                                ExplicitAttributeDecider explicitAttributeDecider,
                                ConvenienceSetterProvider convenienceSetterProvider,
                                boolean enableVisualizationSupport,
                                boolean shouldCloseConnection)
        This is a convenience method that combines the whole metadata extraction and code generation process into a single method while still offering most of the customizability.

        First, this method will use the provided JDBC connection to run SchemaCrawler over the database and extract the metadata. The schemaRule and tableRule will be passed on to SchemaCrawler and can be used to specify the tables for which metadata should be extracted.

        Afterwards the MetadataExtractor gets called and extracts the relevant data into a list of TableModels.

        The third step generates the code and writes it into the source files at the specified location.

        Parameters:
        connection - The established JDBC connection that will be used as the data source for the analysis
        schemaRule - The rule used for inclusion/exclusion of database schemas. Use null or IncludeAll for no filtering.
        tableRule - The rule used for inclusion/Exclusion of database tables. Use null or IncludeAll for no filtering.
        targetPackage - The java package for the generated code. May not be default package. If null, defaults to TableExtractor.DEFAULT_TARGET_PACKAGE
        classPrefix - The prefix for the generated java class names
        targetDirectory - The directory to put the generated source files. The package directory structure will be generated automatically
        dataTypeProvider - The data type provider for customization of the SQL type to java type mapping. If null, a DefaultDataTypeProvider will be used.
        nameProvider - The NameProvider used to determine the names in the generated code
        convenienceSetterProvider - A provider that determines convenience setters
        explicitAttributeDecider - The ExplicitAttributeDecider that will be used to determine whether a attribute / foreign key should be treated as explicitly required
        shouldCloseConnection - Indicates whether the JDBC connection should be closed after the database analysis
